title: Jason Momoa reveals Aquaman tattoos were fake on This Morning
text:
He's earned a dedicated fan following thanks to his chiselled physique.

And so This Morning viewers were delighted to see Jason Momoa make an appearance on Thursday, as he promoted his role in the Apple TV+ series See.

The Game Of Thrones star, 40, also spoke to Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford about his role in the blockbuster Aquaman, and ended a disagreement between the couple by confirming that his bodily tattoos in the film were fake.

Scroll down for video

Hot: Jason Momoa delighted This Morning viewers when he made an appearance on the daytime chat show on Thursday

During the show, Eamonn brought up that he and Ruth had disagreed about whether Jason's tattoos in Aquaman were real, pointing out that they could see an inking on his arm.

The hunky star then confirmed that designers took inspiration from his arm tattoos, but he would spend hours in makeup every day having the other painted on.

He said: 'I'm tattoo free, every morning we put them on every morning,' before explaining that the inking on his arm was the starting point for the incredibly intricate designs.

Hunky: The star made the surprise revelation that the intricate tattoos he sported as Aquaman (pictured in the Justice League film) were fake

Settle it: Hosts Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford asked Jason about his designs as they asked to settle a dispute between them about whether they were real

Funny: Jason confirmed that the tattoos on his body in the film were fake, and he spent hours in makeup having them painted onto his body

Inspired: The Game Of Thrones star also explained that producers took inspiration from a smaller tattoo on his arm that they expanded to his body

Jason was a guest on the show to promote his role in the upcoming big-budget drama See, which is set for release on November 1.

Branded the most expensive TV series ever made, See tells the story of dystopian future when everyone alive has been blinded by a virus from 200 years earlier.

The series begins when Jason characters' wife gives birth to twins, and in a shock twist they can see, but as vision has become a heresy, the couple must protect the children from outside threats.

He appeared on the show with co-star Alfre Woodard, 66, who also appears in the eight-part series, and revealed that the cast underwent a month of 'blindness training' to prepare for the series.

Dynamic duo: Jason was a guest on the show with his co-star Alfre Woodard to promote their roles in the Apple TV+ series See

Over the moon: Viewers were delighted to see Jason make an appearance on the daytime show, and gushed about the hunky star on social media

Explaining his role as Baba Voss, Jason said: 'He's very much a chiefton warrior that protects this small tribe but he's a father he can never have children but he raises these children who aren't his who have sight.'

'You're strengthening a lot of your other senses by removing vision. It's kind of they hit a solar flare and everything electronic was lost and disappeared. Everything is the remnants of a lost world.'

Regardless Jason's appearance on the daytime show delighted viewers, who were happy to have a glimpse of the hunky Hollywood star.

Exciting: The acting pair appear in the big-budget series which will be eight episodes. The first three episodes will be released on November 1

Important: In preparation to play characters that were all-blind, Alfre explained that the cast underwent a month of 'blind training'

Happy: Jason of course rose to prominence when he appeared on Game Of Thrones' first season in 2011, and went onto land the role of the King of Atlantis in Aquaman

One wrote on Twitter: 'Who else only watched #ThisMorning to see Jason Momoa?' while another added: 'There's be love for Jason Momoa soon, can't blame them to be fair a guy with long hair like that damn.'

Another added: 'Jason Momoa is an insanely beautiful man.'

Jason of course rose to prominence when he appeared on Game Of Thrones' first season in 2011, and went onto land the role of the King of Atlantis in Aquaman.

The DC film was lauded as one of the best Justice League films yet, and a sequel has already been confirmed for December 2022.
description: The Game Of Thrones star, 40, spoke to Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford on Thursday about his role in the Apple TV+ series See, as well as his tattoos from his role in Aquaman.
